title: The Sheepshearers

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

exhibition_history:
The Royal Glasgow Institute of the Fine Arts, The Royal Glasgow Institute of the Fine Arts 19th Annual Exhibition, 1880, cat. 31.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Paintings and Sculpture, June 1–November 1, 1934, cat. 199C.

Amsterdam, Van Gogh Museum, Theo van Gogh, 1857–1891: Art Dealer, Collector and Brother of Vincent, May 9–August 22, 1999, cat. 89; traveled to the Paris, Musée d’Orsay, September 20, 1999–January 9, 2000.

Chicago, Illinois, Art Institute of Chicago, Van Gogh's Bedrooms, Feb. 14 - May 10, 2016.
provenance_text: The artist; his studio sale, Hôtel Drouot, Paris, May 10–11, 1875, lot 26 for 7,100 francs [price according to Soullié 1900]. James Duncan (died 1905), London, by 1880 [lent by him to Glasgow 1880]; sold to Boussod, Valadon & Cie., April 12, 1886, for 6,250 francs [according to Groupil stock book no. 17777]; sold to Henri Poidatz (died 1905), Paris, May 22, 1886, for 12,000 francs; sold back to Boussod, Valadon & Cie., December 17, 1888, for 18,000 francs [according to Goupil stock book no. 19589]; sold to Potter Palmer (died 1902), Chicago, March 30, 1889 for 38,480 francs; his widow, Bertha Honoré Palmer (died 1918); by descent to their sons Honoré and Potter Palmer; given by them to the Art Institute, 1922.
